isb:document.isb:docsection: The &appName; project is a library (collection) of classes written in the Java programming language, that are intended to be used for research in computational biology. For more information, please refer to the &appName; home page.

isb:document.isb:docsection: This software requires a Java Runtime Environment (JRE) version 1.4 or newer, because it uses Java 1.4 language features and extensions. This software has been tested on Windows XP and Red Hat Linux 8.0. It should function properly on most Windows platforms and on most major Linux distributions. On other operating systems, you may download the "Other Java-Enabled Platforms" version of the installer.

isb:docsection.name: Source Code
isb:docsection.label: sourcecode
isb:docsection.p: The source code for the &localJavaLibraryName; library is included with the library installer. You can find the code in the file "&localJavaLibraryName;-src.tar.gz" that is installed in the "src" subdirectory of the installation directory for this program.

isb:docsection.name: External Libraries and Credits
isb:docsection.label: extlib
isb:docsection.p: Certain packages in the &appName; library make use of external libraries. In order to successfully compile the &appName; library, you will need to have these external libraries installed on your computer. For a list of external library dependencies and pointers to the web sites where the source code for these libraries can be obtained, please refer to the external libraries section of the user manual.
Many individuals have contributed to the &appName; project, in one form or another. A list of acknowledgements can be found in the User Manual.

isb:docsection.name: Documentation
isb:docsection.label: documentation
isb:docsection.p: For documentation on how to use the &appName; program, please consult the &appName; User Manual. For detailed documentation of the application programming interface (API) to the &appName; library, please consult the ISBJava home page. When &appName; is installed, a PDF version of the API documentation "APIDocumentation.pdf" can be found in the "docs" subdirectory of the installation directory.
